WorkItem.ClosedComment: No evidence of any fault in the PHPExcel code, COUNTA works exactly as expected, and no evidence of problem provided
WorkItem.Description:
My Excel Sheet have COUNTA function(=COUNTA(C17:C16385)).
 
The Cell have COUNTA is removed around border and COUNTA function.
But COUNTA function is  COUNTA(C17:C16384).
It is fine.
 
Attach File's B3 Cell is Bad(=COUNTA(C17:C16385)).
Attach File's B6 Cell is Good(=COUNTA(C17:C16385)).
 
 
Why?

Comments.Message:
First of all, COUNTA() is implemented, and has been for over two years and over 10 releases.

I don't know what you expect to see here. 
The formulae in cells B3 and B6 both execute correctly and both return values of 0 because there are no values anywhere in the worksheet to count. In this case, the COUNTA() function is doing exactly what it should be doing, and returning exactly the same results as Excel itself.
